definitions.definition: A device used to produce music .
examples: The violinist was a master of her instrument .

definitions.definition: A means or agency for achieving an effect.

examples: The instrument detected an increase in radioactivity.

definitions.definition: A tool , implement used for manipulation or measurement .
examples: The dentist set down his tray of instruments .
The scientist recorded the temperature with a thermometer, but wished he had a more accurate instrument .
Flight within clouds must be made by reference to your instruments .

definitions.definition: A legal document, such as a contract , deed , trust , mortgage , power , indenture , or will .
examples: A bond indenture is the instrument that gives a bond its value.
Negotiable instruments are the foundation of the debt markets.

definitions.definition: A person used as a mere tool for achieving a goal.

main_definition: A device used to produce music .
secondary_definitions: A means or agency for achieving an effect.
A tool , implement used for manipulation or measurement .
( law ) A legal document, such as a contract , deed , trust , mortgage , power , indenture , or will .
( figuratively ) A person used as a mere tool for achieving a goal.
